protocol_name: PCR partial Control Region Chaetophractus 456 bp
protocol_name_html: PCR partial Control Region Chaetophractus 456 bp
description: Partial sequences of mtDNA Control Region (CR) were amplified using the universal primers Thr-L15926 (5´-CAATTCCCCGGTCTTGTAAACC-3´), located in the neighboring tRNA-pro gene and DL-H16340 (5´-CCTGAAGTAGGAACCAGATG-3´) (Vilá el al. 1999). Amplification of the double-stranded product was performed in 25 ul volume of PCR mix containing 1.25 U of Taq DNA polymerase, 2.5 ul of 10 x Taq polymerase buffer, 3 mM of MgCl2, 0,16 mM of dNTP´s and 5 pmol of each primer. The amplification was performed in a Biometra T Personal thermocycler. The thermal profile consisted of an initial denaturation at 94 ºC for 5 min, followed by 35 cycles of 94 ºC for 30 s, 56 ºC for 30 s and 72 ºC  for 45 s with a final extension step of 72ºC for 8 min.
protocol_affiliation: CADIC-CONICET Molecular Ecology Lab., Bernardo Houssay 200 Ushuaia, Argentina
manuscript_citation:
Phylogeography of screaming hairy armadillo Chaetophractus vellerosus: successive disjunctions and extinctions due to cyclical climatic changes in southern South America.

 

 

 

Poljak S,  Alejandro M. Ferreiro2, Marina B. Chiappero2, Julieta Sánchez1,3, Magalí Gabrielli4 and Marta S. Lizarralde1,4.
keywords: Chaetophractus vellerosus, cyclical climatic changes, disjunct distribution, phylogeography, screaming hairy armadillo, southern South America.

authors_list.name: Sebastian Poljak
